meanings.definition: Plural of niece: a daughter of one's brother or sister
meanings.sent1: My nieces love playing in the park with their cousins.
meanings.sent2: During the family reunion, all my nieces gathered for a group photo.
meanings.sent3: The nieces giggled as they tried to prank their uncle by hiding his keys.
meanings.sent4: Her nieces were like little rays of sunshine brightening up her day.
meanings.sent5: The nieces' laughter filled the room with joy and warmth.

meanings.definition: Plural of niece: a daughter of one's brother-in-law or sister-in-law
meanings.sent1: Every year, my nieces from my sister-in-law visit us during the holidays.
meanings.sent2: The nieces from my brother-in-law are always excited to go on adventures with me.
meanings.sent3: The nieces from my sister-in-law's side of the family are known for their love of baking cookies.
meanings.sent4: Her nieces from her sister-in-law were like little angels sent to bring her comfort.
meanings.sent5: The nieces from her brother-in-law's family had a special bond that was evident to everyone.
